210 Kennebec Street
Boston, MA 02136
Howard University, School of Communications May 2014
Bachelor of Arts in Communication
Attention to Detail, Calendar Management, General Bookkeeping, Administrative Support
Customer Service, Calendaring/Scheduling, Research, Event Management
Windows Programs (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), Social Media
07/20—7/25 Summer Bounce Lacrosse Coach, MetroLacrosse, Boston, MA
Summer Bounce is an annual overnight summer program for participants entering
grades 7-12 in the fall of 2014
Coordinated daily practices and games for 15 girls;
supervised hiking trips and rock climbing trips; and provided athletic support for at -risk
youth through intensive lacrosse drills.
05/26—5/30 Young Journalism Program, German Embassy, Washington, DC
Journalists from leading journalism schools discovered and discussed the United
States' and Germany’s common interests, endeavors, and challenges in politics and as
societies and how these relate to journalistic work.
Assignment Desk Intern, WUSA9- TV CBS, Washington, DC
Alleviated reporters and producers with stories for live air or follow-ups; conducted
interviews for stories; logged raw video from field; and handled 15-20+ viewer calls per
shift regarding breaking news tips.
Specialized Reporting, NBC-4, Washington, DC
Engaged in training by the head of Strategic Leadership, Newsroom, Engineering and
Community Relations departments at NBC-4; provided support for 3 news reporters;
and sat in on MSNBC programming.
Production Intern, Prince George’s Community Television, Upper Marlboro, MD
Assisted with producing show segments; pitched ideas for weekly programming; and
administered the teleprompter for all shows.
Web and Multimedia Intern, ESPN, Rockville, MD
Attended all Washington Redskins home games; completed the online stats;
spearheaded social networking sites such as Instagram, Twitter and Facebook;
designed banners for ESPN’s clients; and composed stories featured on ESPN’s
website that received over 500 views weekly!
Sports Writer, The Hilltop Newspaper, Howard University, Washington, DC
Wrote stories and features on college sports; attended all Howard home games; and
pitched ideas for weekly articles.
Programming Intern, WHDH-NBC, Boston, MA
Corresponded with non-profit organizations on a weekly basis; controlled events posted
on the Community Calendar; conducted studio tours; and responded to viewer calls and
emails.
Student-Athlete, Howard University Women’s Lacrosse Program, Washington, DC
